channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Check Out the Rensselyrics Fall Invitational!
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 23, 2024 8:00 PM - 10:00 PM - Join the Rensselyrics for their Fall Invitational, Late Night with the Lyrics, this Saturday in the Chapel and Cultural Center! Tickets are being sold all week in the Union and DCC for $5 pre-sale.
item.author: Students

item.title: Dr. Scott Oshiro to Lead Quantum Music Workshop
item.description: Join HASS at 5:00PM on November 21 in Sage 2510 for this hands-on workshop, which offers an introduction to quantum computing with a focus on developing computer music applications. The workshop will cover various building blocks and fundamentals of quantum computing, followed by sections on quantum algorithms and how they are used in current quantum computer music applications.
item.author: Students

item.title: Toys for Tots Campaign Underway through December 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 - Sun , December 8, 2024 (all day) - The 2024 holiday season marks the 77th anniversary of the Marine Corps Reserve Toys for Tots Program, and members of the campus community are invited to consider donating a new, unwrapped toy to join in a special nationwide celebration of this significant milestone!
item.author: Community

item.title: Don’t Miss the RecWell Sports Courts Grand Opening!
item.description: Date: Friday, November 22, 2024 12:30 PM - 2:00 PM - Join the Rensselaer Union Executive Board as they celebrate the grand opening of the new RecWell Sports Courts on Freshman Hill! Refreshments will be provided at the ceremony.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 21, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this information session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Born 24 Years Ago at RPI, Tahira Reid Smith’s “Jump Dreams” Are in Full Swing
item.description: As a third grader, Tahira Reid Smith ’00, ’04, Ph.D., was already thinking like an inventor. So when her school, PS 97 in the Bronx, New York, held a poster contest where students were asked to depict something each of them wished he or she had, she didn’t draw a typical childhood fantasy. She designed a machine.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Building a Global Cyber Community” Topic of November 20 ISC2 Chapter Meeting
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 20, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory will host a cyber workshop with Holly Schneider Brown, Senior Director of ISC2’s Center for Cyber Safety and Education. The workshop, which is open to the RPI community, will focus on building a global cyber community.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum One Computer Scheduled for Maintenance November 20
item.description: The Quantum One computer will be down for a system upgrade on Wednesday, November 20 from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM ET.
item.author: Community

item.title: 22 New Employees Join RPI in October
item.description: Human Resources is thrilled to formally welcome the 22 new employees who joined us in October. Let’s celebrate their arrival and support them as they start their journey with us at RPI!
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Offering Confidential In-Person Retirement Counseling December 3
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
